input_text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to date a christian girl?
input_text.Response A:
Be up front about who you are.
Find out what she likes to do.
Find common ground.
Know what her religion's position is on dating.
Get a date.
Encourage her to share her beliefs.
Go to church with her.
Make yourself part of her spiritual community.
Take time to enjoy one another.
Set boundaries.
Make important decisions together.
Meet one another's needs.
input_text.Response B: Sure, I can do that.  You can start by asking her out on a date, and see how it goes.  If it goes well, you can then ask her out again, and see if you can get her to agree to a second date.  Once you have two dates, you can then ask her out on a third date, and see if you can get her to agree to a fourth date.  After that, you can then ask her out on a fifth date, and see if you can get her to agree to a sixth date.  After that, you can then ask her out on a seventh date, and see if you can get her to agree to an eighth date.  After that, you can then ask her out on a ninth date, and see if you can get her to agree to a tenth date.  After that, you can then ask her out on an eleventh date, and see if you can get her to agree to a twelfth date.  After that, you can then ask her out on a thirteenth date, and see if you can get her to agree to a fourteenth date.  After that, you can then ask her out on a fifteenth date, and see if you can get her to agree to a sixteenth date.  After that, you can then ask her out on a seventeenth date, and see if you can get her to agree to an eighteenth date.  After that, you can then ask her out on a nineteenth date, and see if you can get her to agree to a twentieth date.

label_annotations.factors_a: Although response A answers the question is does so as a list rather that a conversation. It also states "Go on a date" which is what the prompt asks. It also states "Make yourself part of her spiritual community" which some people may feel goes too far
label_annotations.factors_b: This response is just a failure. It repeats itself repeatedly and fails to answer the question
